name: Palace of Culture
description:
Landmark and second tallest building in Poland, 'Gift' from Soviet Union. 

You can visit the viewing tarrace located on the 30th floor with panoramic view at the entire Warsaw. 

Ticket costs 25 PLN per person and can be bought online or at location.

name: Royal Baths
description:
This vast garden is a favourite place for Varsovians where they go for long walks amid beautiful nature and architecture to rest from the hustle and bustle of the city. 

At the heart of the park is the summer residence of the last king of Poland – Stanisław August Poniatowski. The name of the complex comes from the seventeenth-century bathhouse of a Polish nobleman, rebuilt in the 18th century into a palace. Here King Stanisław August Poniatowski hosted his famous Thursday dinners, to which he invited scholars and poets to discuss the issues of the day. Today it is a museum where you can admire paintings from the royal collections. 

Museum ticket is free on Fridays.
